caption: Wonderful food and service 🙏

Delicious fish curry! My friend got the butter chicken. She has not had curry much before and she thought it was really good! Go here for a real taste of Bangladesh and an authentically exquisite experience....
Delicious food! Excellent service!

Best curry dishes in Moscow! We tried the butter chicken and lamb curry, both were awesome! Order the meal with rice and then get a side of pita, only way to do it. I can't wait to come back and try the palak paneer!!
Glad to have this option in the area! Be bold give it a try!

Absolutely delicious food - we were blown away by the taste. I wish there was an option on the menu to order a bigger serving. For instance keep the standard 9oz chicken curry option, but then also add a 13 oz option (keep naan/salad standard size) & increase the price accordingly. The portion size at the current moment is great if you aren’t super hungry (or you’re a small person like me), but definitely don’t think it would fill up an extra hungry human. Anyway, the food was absolutely delicious, and I only say the small suggestion on the portion size because it would be great to eat more without having to order a whole second meal! 😊

Mela is some of the very best food in Moscow. Tonight I took a bit of a risk, and tried a new menu item, lamb chops with red potatoes. The risk paid off—they were delicious. Tender and flavorful. The sauce was cooked into the meat, and had just the right amount of spice. I’ll order it again, and I urge you to!!!
FANTASTIC! Impeccable quality and the very best in customer service - thank you Keaton! WOW...   ❤

Amazing food. Ohh my gosh been on the road for two months craving this quality, flavor food made with love and happiness. Thank you guys for taking the time to explain your menu and let me try the flavor before ordering. It was wonderful!!

Thank you so much for a fabulous meal!  This is the first time I have had Bangladeshi cuisine and I must say it was delightful.  From the first taste, I could taste each ingredient.  No one flavor overpowered another while allowing them to all compliment one another. The service was quite quick and efficient and the staff were very courteous. I had a fantastic experience and I will definitely return to try more of these great dishes.

I have walked past Mela many times in the last year and my husband and I finally decided to check it out. We really enjoyed it and will definitely go again! I have celiac disease (so no gluten for me) and Mela’s menu is mostly gluten free!! The menu clearly states which meals have gluten (and dairy and soy and meat) and the server and owner were very knowledgeable and aware of what was safe for me to eat. The server made sure to be extra careful when preparing my meal which was amazing!! The food was excellent and the portion size was perfect for me! The price was really good for home cooked food and fresh ingredients. Will definitely recommend Mela to friends!!
Delicious food and wonderful hospitality! We always enjoy our meals.

I had a terrible experience yesterday and truly didn't want to mention it until the server acted disrespectfully. I go to order and the young lady taking my order had dandruff all over her hair, I didn't just want to leave but I knew I wasn't eating the food. After paying for the food I'm not gonna be eating, I decided not to give a tip. The server comes out to hand me the food and sarcastically says thank you for your service. No thank you for your service.

I don't know anything about Bangledeshi cuisine but after eating here just one time I now want to know all there is to know! I went with my family and we ordered four meals and all were extraordinary! The location has an outdoor treehouse/play area for kids, so my little one was able to play while the adults ate. Truly the best restaurant experience I've had in a long time

TLDR: too expensive for what they are serving.  Ordered lamb curry and samosas (3.50 one large potsticker size!). Flavor is ok but I think the prices are waay expensive considering the serving size is small, and cafeteria style self service ordering.

This restaurant serves luscious, delicious and mouthwatering food that entices all to salivate and goggle. We ordered the butter chicken and biryani and it was the perfect blend of authentic spices without the heat. Would recommend to all of my Indian and Bengali friends and family.
Very authentic and delicious. ❤️❤️ Loved it.
The food here is awesome! It's a little pricy, but worth it since portion sizes are big enough to satisfy. Plus they are very friendly.

My wife and I dined in and was very impressed with the food. We got the chicken tikka and the garbanzo curry with rice and naan bread. The portions were perfect. I have a tendency to eat a lot, but was very satisfied with the portion sizes. The food was excellent and the staff was exceptionally polite and accommodating.
Loved the Bangladeshi style Pakora and the fresh mango lassi!!!
Excellent food, exceptional service.

Hidden Gem!  Awesome food, Awesome people, Awesome Atmosphere. Authentic Bangladeshi Flavors!  Chicken Briyani and Salmon Curry. Mouthwatering! Shahin (Onwer) was amazing. Keaton served us after 8 ! Surely they serve as a team.  Must visit if you are in the area.  Shafayet & Munia

Mela was incredibly delicious. I ordered the butter chicken with a mango drink. The food was fresh, delicious, rich but not too heavy. The staff were very kind and the owner was very hospitable. I highly recommend Mela if you are looking for great, fresh food!
Mela was wonderful! I got the Briyani chicken and it was so flavorful and delicious. They also offered great service with friendly staff. Highly recommend!!
Excellent food with great service. I loved both the items that I ate.

The food was good and service with a smile, but portions were super small given the price,  and we didn't get all the food we ordered for curbside delivery, even though they did not appear to be busy at all... we were the only customers curbside during the 10 minutes we waited.

This place has absolutely the best food! And the employees were super-sweet! SO glad they are open for take-out during the State's stay-in-place request. Being my first order with them, I have never dined there, but it will be the first place I go when they re-open for dine-in. Until then, take-out here I come!! Thanks for being so amazing

We had a fabulous dinner at Mela.  Ordered the butter chicken and loved it.  Took us to a world far from Idaho.  People were lovely, and most helpful—we are not familiar with Bangla Deshi cuisine.  Highly recommend this restaurant. Very reasonable too.
The butter chicken was wonderful!
My wife and I LOVE this place. A little slow, but that's what it takes for home cooked good good

It may look like  neighborhood food joint, Mela is anything but! I wandered in with a friend on a Saturday afternoon, and was immediately greeted by the friendly staff and incredible aroma of Bangladeshi cuisine. We ordered chicken biryani and raspberry  🍋. The biryani was amazing. It had the right texture and the perfect balance of spices. The chicken was juicy and the rice was perfectly cooked. Raspberry drink was the perfect companion with the biryani. It was refreshing! Don’t let appearances fool you—the decor may be divey, but the dishes are fantastic. This place is perfect for groups or a casual take out.

Most amazing foreign food we have had in Idaho. So delicious makes you feel like your in another country. Made to perfection with absolutely wonderful customer service. I will definitely recommend any one to try. Their house sauce is so amazing if you like spice. So fresh and filling. By far my new favorite.
Tasty! Authentic, healthy menu with great vegan and vegetarian options. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be back for more!
Delicoous and auper friendly.

What a wonderful treat to find delicious Bangladeshi food in Moscow, Idaho! We thoroughly enjoyed the garbanzo and the salmon curries and we appreciated getting to chat with Shaheen, the founder. Mela is a gem that we're sure to return to!

One of the best restaurants I have ever been.. The food is awesome. I just loved it.. I ordered a butter chicken which is a curry dish. So delicious. The owner is a wonderful women. Stuffs are very friendly.. if you haven’t tried it yet, you are missing something big!!
Nice little place for good food. If you want to taste authentic Bangladeshi food, this is the place to be. It also has a good open place to sit, eat and enjoy the weather when it is nice outside.

Very small place, but the food has an amazing taste. I had the lamb curry the flavor was some of the best I ever had, just wished it was a little hotter. My other three guests loved their meals as well. I would recommend this place to everyone. Spoke to the owner and she was very friendly. Will definitely visit again when we are back in town .
Owner was super welcoming. Food was excellent. Highly recommend the veggie samosa with the tamarind sauce! Definitely coming back again:)
Excellent Indian Cuisine! Great portions and the flavors are fantastic in the dishes. I highly recommend, prices little high but still amazing food.
Excellent little getaway for some high quality food. The prices are a tiny bit high and there is a wait for the food, but trust me, it's worth it 100%

This is the type of food that the Palouse has needed for a long time.  The fact that it is so affordable and the staff provides excellent service in a very modest environment is  what puts this place on my go to top spots. Yum!
Small intimate space, terrific food and friendly people.
Pretty good food!
Enjoyed some nice lamb curry with naan. More people need know about this place
Delicious and authentic food with very friendly and welcoming staff and service
Phenomenal food, run by sweethearts. 👍👍
AMAZING! Delicious food and great personal service! Ordered the Pakora Tiki Masala and highly recommend it!
The food is really amazing here and the owners give great customer service. I'm from a much larger city and miss good Indian food  this definitely hits the spot.

Amazing food, very friendly staff. One of the best and highest quality I've had the pleasure of tasting. This place makes food that they themselves would eat, and it is simply amazing. I would highly recommend this place, and I definitely will be back here often! Do take note that this is a Bangladesh cuisine, not Indian. They are very similar, but you can expect less sauce than what you'd expect at a Indian restaurant.
Awesome taste and ambiance. Authentic Bangladeshi flavor and taste.
Wow. The food is wow.
It’s expensive for the portion size they give

The service here is first class. The food selection offers something for everyone. They also have vegetarian options. Price is well worth the amount of food you get and if you have any questions all you need to do is ask. Some dushes are a little spicy so ask if you need a more mild choice and you'll be well taken care of.
So good! The meal was delicious! Very good ingredients, and good portion size. A little spicy for me, but I will be more careful in ordering next time. Still, amazing quality and taste!
The food here is delicious, I definitely recommend trying the butter chicken and curry chicken. The staff are very friendly and the environment is nice, great place for a nice meal.
Excellent food--especially the paneer and samosas. The whole family loves this place, and it's great to sit outside in the summer and enjoy the weather and the company.

I just tried this place today and I am in love with their food quality! I ordered chicken tikka masala with mango lassi for a drink and it was delicious! Definitely recommend and will come back again.
DELICIOUS food at a great price. New favorite spot 👌🏻
Authentic Bangladeshi food with excellent taste.
Yummy cuisine and wonderful hostess! I love that she recommended somethings with a variety of tastes!
Amazing food & wonderful service!

It is what it is and it does that well. The physical setting is a hole in the wall BUT they'll bring your food over to Slice, so you can drink one of their 24 taps (100+ cans), wine, or coffee. And in good weather it's a happening square with kids running everywhere. The menu is limited but the food is tasty. It's better to do a few things well than a hundred things adequately. So far I've had the curry, biryani, and samosas, and the flavor is the reason for the long lines at the Farmer's Market. I've been to many dozens of Indian and Desi restaurants around the US. There's something about Bangla cooking to differentiate it from Indian; I couldn't describe it but Mela has it, and it's a welcome difference versus generic Americanized Indian fare. It's also wonderful to enjoy a bit of spiciness without having to beg for it. We are blessed to have two south Asian establishments in town now. For formal guests I need to impress with ambience I'll go to Karma but for myself and friends, a tasty curry with IPAs is unbeatable. 5/4/2019 update: got the lamb curry, delivered to the bar at Slice. The lamb was tender and lean, the curry was spicy and delectable, and the rice was infused with cumin and cardamom (or something. Wonderful spices). Mmmmm.

Our family cooks classic Indian food often, and we understand that to achieve that remarkable balance of subtlety yet intensity, much time is necessary. Mela presents one with food that reflects that long cooking time. This Bangladeshi variant of classic Indian cooking is simply superb. A rare find outside of large cities, truly a gem.

A small, out of the way spot in Moscow. One of several restaurants enclosing a courtyard with plenty of seating and a more secure play-place for the littles. Seating is also available inside. It didn't look like it at first, but when you go inside to order there is a bar and a table and chairs. It was rainy when we went so this was a deal-breaker if there was no indoor seating.  The food is made by an actual Indian woman from family recipes. I had the Paneer with spinach and was told that it is prepared differently than other places. It was delicious even though it didn't look very appetizing. I have not eaten it before so I wasn't sure what to expect. The sauce has pureed spinach, so no stringy wilted leaves,  and large cubes of cheese. You can get it with rice or peas instead of the spinach, as well as naan, which I did. A small salad makes the meal. I also tried the Mango Lassi which was very good; can't go wrong there. My husband got the chicken curry and enjoyed it as well. Prices are pretty reasonable for what you get. Portions aren't small or over the top large either. The menu online doesn't have all the available options. When we went there she also had a salmon curry that sounded intriguing. There were other menu items listed as well. Credit/Debit is accepted. Not sure about checks. I would definitely recommend and will go back to try other things there as well.
I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken tikka masala! It was full of authentic flavors that were not masked by too much butter or too much heat (spice). And the owners are absolutely lovely!
Wonderful experience. The owners were welcoming and friendly. The food superb! We had lamb curry and chicken curry. If you want extra spicy ask for the green sauce-awesome 👍
The owners are the sweetest people! And that's just the beginning. I had the palak paneer, gulab jamun, and had a taste of a friend's chicken Tikka masala. Every bite was life changing.
The food was absolutely delicious! The chicken tikka masala I had was incredibly rich and buttery without being to heavy, and the golab jamun was not too sweet, which I really appreciated.
We have always had wonderful, flavorful food.  So glad you're in Moscow.

Beautiful, exquisite, hand-crafted food from a local artisan chef. Inspired by country, culture, and careful culinary blends, Mela serves up dishes that are balanced nutritionally and aesthetically. You eat. You leave full, but not heavy. You come back for more, or you try something different next time. And you gain a friend every time you speak with the staff!

A tiny restaurant with big flavor.  Delicious food and excellent service make this restaurant shine.  I'm especially fond of the butter chicken and chicken tikka masala.  I definitely recommend Mela when you have an Indian food craving.
6 out of 5 stars. Gives me memories of my grandmas amazing home cooking. I will always remember to visit this place if I want good comfort food.
The food is excellent, the people are kind and the portion sizes are generous. Great place to eat.

Food quality is great, but the price point is really high for the portions, and the service, while not explicitly bad, isn't great. Most mediocre, "okay", I-might-go-again-I-might-not place I've ever been. Solid 3 stars, like the pH of water.

My wife and I have been coming to Mela regularly since it opened.  It's great to have a restaurant in town that serves terrific, authentic, South Asian cuisine. The curries have a depth of flavors that can only come with proper slow cooking and adept use of spices. A lot of love is put into the food and it shows.  Oh, and the owners treat you like family.
Food is fresh, homemade, and delicious!! Lots of gluten free options which keeps me going back. They can even make garbanzos taste amazing

I have loved Mela since they opened at the Farmers Market - their garbanzo curry was the only thing I wanted to eat when I was pregnant with my second child!  And when we were pregnant again and very sick Abtesam blessed us with food!!! They are such a kind family - and her sons always made me laugh 😄 - and you can tell that cooking food for people is her calling. I am so grateful we can now have the beautiful flavors of Bangladesh outside of market season.  Tonight our family of five feasted on the garbanzo curry, the lamb curry (amazing), and the paneer curry plus lentil soup (she added that in for us, because she just cannot quit being generous) and an order of piyaju (pakora). The sauces are beautiful, balanced, and perfectly spicy (my kids love it, but I know not all kids are accustomed to spice). I crave these flavors!  It’s easy to pop in to their 2nd street location (it’s tucked away on the east side of the patio near the play structure) and place an order for take out, though there is also a small area to dine in along a bar with stools. Our large to-go order was ready in less than ten minutes. You could also eat outside on the patio.  A meal is perfectly sized for a hearty adult portion (comes with salad and a choice of naan or rice) and easily shared by smaller kids.  Everything is made from scratch, and it is like being invited to sit down at the table and feast with their family, that’s the Mela magic. This food is made with love.
Mela is a mom and pop, hole in the wall place in the best way possible! The food is delicious and the owners are kind and inviting.
Best authentic cuisine around! Excellent service

The owners are awesome! Brought us our food over at Slice then came back to see how it was. The space is very limited but they make it work. I can't wait to try more! Oh, and the Piyaju was delicious!

Finding the entrance was a bit confusing, but was it worth the search! The food was amazing and the customer service was impeccable! I can really tell that the owner loves what she does, and you can taste it in the food!

Tender boneless lamb curry. Delicious garbanzo curry too. Spicy without lighting your hair on fire. Fast, friendly service. The owner found out we were from out of town and treated us to extra samosas which were also yummy. Just what moscow needed.
The best quality Bangladeshi food you will get at Mela. Thanks for opening a restaurant finally!!!

I was super excited to come here! - then when I got there I realized I knew the family and it was like a homecoming! The food was exactly the way I expected- delicious! Samosa heaven! Everything was fresh. -it's small because its brand new and I'm so excited to see this place grow!
Delicious, so glad they opened a resteraunt
The food is fantastic, flavorful and plentiful. Generous portions and everything is very fresh.

TLDR: Food: 4/5 Service: 5/5 Venue: 4/5  More of a food court type place than a restaurant. The current chicken was great,  veggies are generic. Naan bread was pretty good could be better, don't believe they make their own Naan bread(don't quote me on that). Mango Lassi was not too sweet, that's a plus. Probably the best Indian food around this area, but the selection is lacking.

This is a great place to have authentic Bangladeshi food. If you are looking for a different taste, halal food, something new, quick bite, or heavy meal- Mela offers all of these. Great service, friendly people, nice ambiance and obviously amazing delicious food. I am certainly going back and recommend this not only to people from the sub-continent but to everyone.
Finally a desi place in palouse.

After years of popularity as a Farmer’s market stand and caterer, Mela’s finally given in to popular demand and opened a restaurant.  For the last few years, Moscow’s had a thriving restaurant scene with a notable absence of South Asian cuisine.  Mela is filling that gap, and doing it wonderfully.  Their opening night in mid-August of 2018 packed their courtyard with hungry fans & friends.  We enjoyed plates piled with Paneer, Biryani, Naan, Samosas and other favorites.  In good weather, their courtyard is one of the most pleasant places in Moscow to enjoy a meal.  Now, Mela lets you pair that excellent location with some of the best food in town.
Really good food!
The most awaited restaurant. Thank you so much MELA for your continued awesome food to experience. FARMERS MARKET -> MELA (WOODEN ROOF) you are awesome
So glad to have some Desi food in the palouse..

Finally the wait for authentic Bangladeshi food is over. Mela is going to serve its customers in the heart of the university town from Aug 13. From their past record of catering food, I can guarantee that they will prove themselves to be one of the bests in town. All the best for the new journey of Mela. Can't wait to try yummy mouthwatering food from Mela.
